one.title: FIRST DAY: Read the notes and the references.

questions.questionText: 1. Use this space to record how you have seen God's activity during the week. (How has He provided, answered, comforted, reconciled, guided, etc.?)
2. From the past week's study, what made the most significant impact to you in the notes, lecture, group sharing or personal study?

two.title:
SECOND DAY: Read 2 Samuel 5:1-16.
The Lord established David as Israel's king.

questions.questionText: 3. What reasons did Israel's tribes give for making David king? How did David's rise to power validate God's call and years of waiting? (1 Samuel 16:11-13)
4. What characteristics does David exhibit in these verses? What opportunities is God giving you to develop these characteristics?
5. How did David understand the reason and purpose for his success? Where has God placed you so you will bless those around you?

three.title:
THIRD DAY: Read 2 Samuel 5:17-25 and Psalm 68.
God delivered David from the Philistines twice.

questions.questionText: 6. How did David respond to the Philistine threat? When have you recently prayed for wisdom and direction? What were the results?
7. From Psalm 68, for what attributes of God does David praise God?
8. What encourages or challenges you most about David's worship and understanding of God?

four.title:
FOURTH DAY: Read 2 Samuel 6:1-11; 1 Chronicles 13:1-14.
David disobeyed God's instructions for moving the ark.

questions.questionText: 9. Why might David want the ark of the covenant in Jerusalem? Who confirmed his plans?
10. Why did God respond the way He did? What lessons do you learn? (Exodus 25:10-22; Numbers 4:5-6, 15)
11. How has this study challenged or enlarged your view of God? How will this impact the way you live?

five.title:
FIFTH DAY: Read 2 Samuel 6:12-23; 1 Chronicles 15:1-16:43.
David brought the ark to Jerusalem with great celebration.

questions.questionText: 12. What differences did you notice when the ark was moved the second time? What do you learn from that?
13. How did David celebrate his love and thankfulness to God? For what will you celebrate and thank God?
14. How did Michal respond to David's expressive worship? What can you learn from David's response when others ridicule you?

six.title: SIXTH DAY: Review 2 Samuel 5-6; 1 Chronicles 11:1-9; 12:1-16:43; Psalm 68.

questions.questionText: 15. What was your biggest takeaway from your personal study of this week's lesson?
